Intentionally Subject an Individual at Risk to Abuse - Cause Bodily Harm

result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin R Holmstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).
  • 4th Degree Sexual Assault, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.225(3m).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Must report to probation by 3:00 PM on Wednesday, October 28, 2015.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must have no abusive or sexual contact with victim C.D.N.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent including psychosexual evaluation. 
Court reserves the finding on sex offender registration requirement until sex offender evaluation is complete and the report is filed. 
Must submit DNA sample (within 30 days) and pay the surcharge.
AODA and comply with recommended follow-up treatment.

Jury fees are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Courts as they are not a condition of his probation. May set up a payment plan. 
Probation does NOT collect jury fees in the amount of $1501.11.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 4 days credit if revoked.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: count 1 together with conditions.
Concurrent with: counts 1 and 2 together with conditions.
Concurrent with: counts 1, 2 and 3 together with conditions.

Defendant Melvin R Holmstrom in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

8:35  Court relates and gives appearances. 
8:36  State indicates they will be filing amend information.
8:37  Court recesses.
8:48  Court resumes.  Amended Information filed.
8:49  Court relates and questions Melvin Holmstrom.
9:15  State relates.
9:17  Atty. Schlough makes argument.
9:20  Court relates

Of amended information:
Count #1:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #2:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #3:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.
Count #4:  Defendant pleads guilty.  Court finds defendant guilty.

SW
3 years probation
Complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by PO, to include psycho-sexual offender evaluation, AODA assessment.
No abusive or sexual contact with victim C.D.N.
Pay all costs and fees.
4 days jail credit if revoked (against count #1)
Court reserves finding of sex offender registration until sex offender evaluation is complete, and report is filed.  Hearing will be set on this matter once report is in.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge on each count.  
DNA sample to be provided within 30 days of today's date
Report to probation no later than 3:00 PM on Wed; 10/28/15.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court.


Pay jury fees to Clerk of Court (may be on payment plan.)  This is not a condition of probation.
